stk.calculators.energy.macromodel module¶

class stk.calculators.energy.macromodel.MacroModelEnergy(macromodel_path, output_dir=None, force_field=16, use_cache=False)¶

Bases: stk.calculators.energy.energy_calculators.EnergyCalculator

Calculates the energy using MacroModel.

macromodel_path¶

The full path of the Schrodinger suite within the user’s machine. For example, on a Linux machine this may be something like '/opt/schrodinger2017-2'.

Type:str
output_dir¶

The name of the directory into which files generated during the optimization are written, if None then uuid.uuid4() is used.

Type:str
force_field¶

The number of the force field to be used.

Type:int
__init__(macromodel_path, output_dir=None, force_field=16, use_cache=False)¶
Parameters:
  • macromodel_path (str) – The full path of the Schrodinger suite within the user’s machine. For example, on a Linux machine this may be something like '/opt/schrodinger2017-2'.
  • output_dir (str, optional) – The name of the directory into which files generated during the optimization are written, if None then uuid.uuid4() is used.
  • force_field (int, optional) – The number of the force field to be used.
  • use_cache (bool, optional) – If True energy() will not run twice on the same molecule and conformer, but will instead return the previously calculated value.
energy(mol, conformer=-1)¶

Calculates the energy of mol.

Parameters:
  • mol (Molecule) – The Molecule whose energy is to be calculated.
  • conformer (int, optinal) – The conformer of mol to use.
Returns:

The energy.
Return type:

float
Raises:

EnergyError – This exception is raised if no energy value is found in the MacroModel calculation’s .log file. Likely due to a forcefield error.
